boardgame.name: Wanderlust: Transsiberian
boardgame.description:
Wanderlust: Transsiberian is a single-story standalone game in the acclaimed Wanderlust series. Embark on a trip to the easternmost reaches of Eurasia onboard the longest railway line in the world.

Get lost in Siberia.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Don't Look Back: Final Girls Expansion
boardgame.description:
Expand your games of Don't Look Back with these 4 new heroines. Complete with printed character cards and a final girl curse sheet, these characters will add new fresh playstyles and tactics to your fight against The Killer.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 4 Heroine character miniatures (Kat Grifter, Chisaki O, Rachel Newton, and Dr. Grange) and their character sheets to the base game.

boardgame.name: MAGICSPORT Magnetfussball
boardgame.description:
Collectible Football (Soccer) game with comic style animal teams.

Can be played on any even underground (i.e. table or smooth floor) or on the Football field mat included in the main package.

The figures were included in the known „Kinder Überraschung“ („Kinder Surprise“). These chocolate eggs were very popular in Germany and other countries.

They alway had a yellow capsula inside, which contained some small toy - about 1/7 to a certain campaign theme, like Asterix, the Smurfs or - in 2006 - before the Football World championship in Germany: Comic animal footballers with a magnetic bade.

They could be used to „push“ around the metall „football“ to score goals,

There were 5 teams (Yellow / Red / White / Blue / Green) and some accesories to be collected. Each complete Team had 1 goal keeper and 2 field players. But even with only 2 players one could have a little soccer game on any table etc

Hieronymus beasts is a creature beastiary from the works of the dutch painter Jeroen van Aken, more know as Hieronymus Bosch. Through monsters it tells the tale of the curse that befell the Shadow King of Grift and the disgraced destiny of his son, a nice addition to the lore of MÖRK BORG.

boardgame.name: The Hellfirefly Swarm
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Look to the West.
Forth comes fire,
and a horde,
and the Kingdoms burn.

The bell tolls again. The heat growns. A swarm comes forth. The royalty of fire is your enemy. Will you douse the fire? or become ash?

boardgame.name: The Sacred Map of Nahemoth

Pick a desire
And follow its path
Your chosen one
Despair becomes

Spill some blood and turn it into the ink that draws the path for your wildest dreams. Just make sure the blood doesn't end up being yours.

boardgame.name: The Knight of the Unclean Light
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Now you’ve done it you freak shit, you’ve fucked up and fail both as a holy knight and as a human being, you have found pleasure in the most disgusting and repugnant fetishes of mankind, you have been corrupted by sickening powers that you may never understand, the illness that killed the gods has manifested in physical form, the divine feces make all mighty, the great unclean lady, you now pray to her as she is the only one that can stomach your presence.

boardgame.name: Zelle
boardgame.description: Zelle is a occult adventure game. You can explore the inside and outside of the castle using adventure game mechanics and battle demons with strategic mouse clicks. Your goal in this game is to bring the protagonist home. -- Steam

Shadowrun: The Trading Card Game – Unterwelt
boardgame.description:
The first and only published expansion to Shadowrun: The Card Game is called Underworld and it's focus is on the Yakuza, Mafia, Lone Star and specific gangs like the Halloweeners, Ancients, and others. In addition, the set added more Spells, Spirits, Drones and other Gear to equip your Runners with.

The release date was January 1998. The cards from this set are identified by the letter "U" before the Copyright on the bottom of the cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Shadowrun: The Trading Card Game

boardgame.name: Ratingen-Spiel
boardgame.description:
This is a game about the German city of Ratingen, and was likely part of a radio promotion (Radio Neandertal UKW 97.6).

The board is divided into districts. Players place tiles representing a different industry (service, trade, hospitality, leisure, residential) into matching districts and score points based on which where it was played and how many other tiles had been played there. There are also three, black-bordered wild plots that can be from any industry. The game comes with 60 tiles and show actual companies and organizations from Ratingen ... or at least were in Ratingen in 1998.

To begin the game, the tiles are shuffled and placed face down in a general supply. Each player draws 6 tiles and places them face up in front of them.

On each turn, the following may happen:


Exchange: The active player may give two tiles to another player and take one of their tiles. This cannot be refused.
Place Tiles: The player may place as many tiles as they want onto empty plots in one district. Tiles much match the plots by color. The player then scores points according to what is printed on the board for that district and the number of tiles placed there.
Draw Tiles: The player draws 0-3 tiles from the supply. This number must be announced before the first tile is drawn.


Each action is optional, but they must be performed in the above order.

The game ends when all plots have been filled, or if one player has placed 5 sets of tiles on the board (i.e. placed tiles on 5 separate occasions during the game). If that happens, all other players get one more turn each. Each remaining unplayed tile is -5 points for the player holding them, and then whoever has the highest score wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Don't Be a Dik Dik
boardgame.description:
There are lots of naughty names in nature, and we've brought them to you in this hilarious card game. The aim of the game is to get rid of all your cards by collecting pairs and passing wisely...and, most importantly don't be a DIK DIK! Ask any of your fellow players if they have your card to secure a matching pair. If you end the game with the DIK DIK card, tough luck, you're a DIK DIK, you lose!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
New with seal intact.
Please have a PayPal account before ordering. I can only ship to the address PayPal has on file. I pack games to help protect from damage. Shipping is $8.00 to US addresses only.

boardgame.name: Chickasaw Bayou: The Battle of Walnut Hills, December 26-29, 1862
boardgame.description:
Chickasaw Bayou was a grand missed opportunity for the Union Army in its desire to crush the Rebellion. If they had proceeded with haste, the Federals could have captured Vicksburg and delivered a master stroke against the Rebels a sure seven months before Vicksburg surrendered on July 4th 1863.

The Union player is as much fighting against the terrain as the Confederate Army. The third player are the Swamps of Chickasaw Bayou and they are no friend of the Union player.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Potion Craft
Potion Craft: Alchemist Simulator
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





You play as an aspiring alchemist who had to leave their hometown, as you wander the land looking for a new place to stay you stumble upon an abandoned cottage. From the looks of it a wizard used to reside here long ago. You decide to make this your home and convert the place into a potion shop. That means it’s time for you to start your journey down The Alchemist’s Path, learn the secrets of potion making, and forge your own destiny to become the alchemist this town needs!Game Features


Manage a medieval potion shop. Meet your fellow townsfolk, understand their needs from the stories they are telling you, and sell them the right potions to keep your business running. Buy and sell ingredients, grow your own in Enchanted garden, and do whatever it takes to stay in business.
Unique visuals inspired by medieval manuscripts and medical texts. Dive into an authentic medieval atmosphere created by carefully crafted characters, interiors, and a relaxing soundtrack.
Hyper satisfying physical interactions with ingredients and equipment. Harvest herbs, mushrooms, & crystals from the Enchanted Garden. Grind them carefully with your mortar and pestle to release their effects and add them to your cauldron.
Sandbox style Alchemy map system. Mix up a nice healing infusion with mana restoration, or add a frost effect to your regular poison for some extra spice. Fire, frost, healing, poison, explosion, magical vision, invisibility... your potions potential is limitless!


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Dead Road
Dear ROad: R&W Survivor
boardgame.description:
Dead Road is a survival game in a post-apocalyptic world in which you must survive together with your community, reaching the proposed goals to prosper. In this world you must go to places and find the necessary resources to achieve these goals, but you will meet Zombies on the path that you must eliminate to continue on your way.

Dead Road is a single player roll and write survival game.
With a maximum of 40 minutes of play and for people over 10 years old.

Objective

Reach each goal from levels 1 to 5 by getting the resources necessary for each level. Future expansions will have additional goals that the player must reach to win.

What do you need to play?


One printed sheet of paper (we recommend putting the sheet in a polypropylene protector).
One red Dice D-Six to simulate the Horde’s moves, both walking and attacking.
A few Dice D-Six to simulate the survivors.
Two whiteboard markers. We recommend using a red marker for the March of the Horde and for Morale, and a blue one for the inventory.
A few tokens or Meeples to simulate the survivors.


—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dead Road: Motor Club

boardgame.name: DecKreative
boardgame.description:
Light a spark of randomness in
your game nights and creations!

Dec-Kreative is a deck of cards full of randomized prompts to help any kind of creative people!
Every card also contains additional, funny rules that you can apply when you play board games or RPGs!
Will you be willing to pay the penance? ?

An exaggeration of prompts!
Every Dec-Kreative card contains:


A complete set of dice with random values (D10, D100, D4, D6, D8, D12, D20).
An alphabet letter.
An hour of the day, counter or clockwise.
A weather symbol.
An emotion with a moral alignment.
A target on a humanoid dummy.
A class/job.


Plus, a system to make teams from 2 to 10 people, grouping them for:


On/Off; Black/White.
Rock, Paper, Scissors.
Card suits / Elements / Seasons.
Fingers of the hand / Senses / Zener cards.
Chess pieces.
Musical notes / days of the week / Deadly Sins.
The Winds.
The Muses.
The Commitments.


All these elements can be used also as randomic prompts.

Furthermore:

Additional rule to apply to the game in progress.
Penance to pay if mistaken.
First player and tie-breaker method.


When you are stuck, pick a card and let imagination flow!

boardgame.name: ZipWarZ Quick Start Game
boardgame.description:
A Free Intro to ZipWarZ.

Welcome to the ZipWarZ Quick Start Game, a great place to begin playing the 2-player, rules-lite war game system: ZipWarZ. In the game, each player brings customized armies to the battlefield in an attempt to vie for victory using tactical movements, devastating attacks, and special abilities. The player who gains the most Victory Points by the end of round 4 wins the game.

This game includes 2 pre-generated armies, a player board, and all the rules to play the game. Best of all... it's free.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ancient Terrible Things: Reawakened
boardgame.description:
Ancient Terrible Things: Reawakened is a pulp-horror tabletop game for 1-4 players,
in which you play the role of an intrepid but foolish adventurer exploring a dark jungle river.
Each turn you must travel to a Fateful Location and face an Ominous Encounter.
If you overcome the Encounter (using a combination of dice, tokens and cards) you gain Secrets.
The object of the game is to be the player with the most Secrets when the game ends at the Inexplicable Event.

Game play involves rolling dice to achieve combinations: runs, pairs, three or more of a kind, and single die showing a particular number or higher. Dice combinations are spent to overcome Encounters and to acquire the four resources used in the game: Focus, Courage, Treasure and Feat tokens.


Focus tokens are used to activate Swag cards to better manipulate dice results.
Courage tokens are spent to overcome an Encounter before rolling any dice.
Treasure tokens are spent to purchase useful Swag cards which give you a permanent game effect.
Feat tokens are spent to play one-shot Feat cards from your hand.


Ancient Terrible Things: Reawakened is the third implementation of the Dicequest game system as previously used in Ancient Terrible Things (1st/2nd Edition) and Konja.
The third edition incorporates edited and revised content from all previous iterations and expansions of the game, new renovated art and language-independent graphic design into a single definitive edition of ATT.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cepheus Cards
boardgame.description:
[Back cover blurb]

Designed to be used with Cepheus Engine (or your favourite 2D6 based science fiction game) these cards give you a new mechanism to use at the table. The cards are designed to add an air of levity and a more heroic feel to your games.

Cards are freely given out to players who can use them to grant their character a temporary skill boost or ability. Some are serious some are a little silly, but they all allow the characters by achieve what might otherwise be unattainable.

boardgame.name: El Gran Capitán: Campaigns of the Italian Wars 1494-1530 – Vol.2
boardgame.description:
This second volume includes all the major campaigns fought in Southern Italy:

Ferrandino’s War, 1495-96, the Aragonese, with the help of El Gran Capitán, retake the Kingdom of Naples to the French.
The fight for the Kingdom of Naples, 1502-1503, the French and Spanish, led by El Gran Capitán, fight for the Kingdom of Naples. This campaign historically included the two most famous battles of Cerignola and Garigliano (1503), where Cordoba gained the title "El Gran Capitán".
Lautrec’s last chance, 1528, the unfortunate campaign of Lautrec to conquer Naples once again
The crusade of Charles VIII (a what-if scenario), 1495-96, what if Charles VIII would have not decided to come back to France soon after his conquer of the Kingdom of Naples ?


These were longer campaigns with respect to the first game, and fought on larger areas. Scale has been adapted to these facts (3x in space and time)


the game system of All is lost save Honour, scaled 3x to adapt it to campaigns which were longer and fought on much wider areas
operational-level warfare in the XVIth century
highly interactive sequence of play, focused on manoeuvre and careful planning
various forms of combat: Major battles,Skirmishes, Sieges
a 22" x 34" fine-art map , reproducing all of XVIth southern Italy, based on an accurate study of ancient maps and sources
gorgeous iconic counters representing all the main Capitani who fought there and the different combat units
detailed (as it is possible) order of battle, with combat units differentiated by strength, maximum movement, quality and reliability
very low counter density and limited play time

boardgame.name: Cepheus Galaxy
boardgame.description:
A subsector (a region of space) generator, for use in Cepheus Engine or other 2D6 based role playing game. Comes as a file you can double click, which opens in your browser and allows you to generate a near infinite number of subsectors.

You can also edit the entries that are generated.

boardgame.name: Horrible Histories: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
How well do you know your history? The ghastly-fun but educational Horrible Histories Board Game will have players frantically racing through history!

Move from the Awful Ancients to the Measly Middle Ages, through the Terrible Tudors and the Vile Victorians to the modern times by answering “Horrible” multiple-choice questions, acting out charades and trying to avoid Rattus and his tricky “Chance” cards!

Based on the award-winning Horrible Histories series, this family fun, educational board game encourages learning through play and is perfect for 2-4 players age 8 years and over.

As you race to the finishing line your knowledge of history will help you move faster and win.

boardgame.name: Paratime Cop
boardgame.description:
[back cover blurb]
Time travel! Alternate realities!

Paratime Cop is a campaign primer for Cepheus Engine (and other 2D6 based science fiction systems). This book is designed to give the referee guidance on playing a new kind of campaign. With this primer you’ll be inspired to start a campaign where Time Travel and Alternate Realitys are normal.

The players take on the role of Paratime Cops chasing criminals across the time lines.
“Paratime” was an invention of the classic science fiction author H. Beam Piper. This product launches the PCs into the world(s) created by Piper.

Included in this package is an audiobook and the text of the story “Genesis” by H. Beam Piper which is the first of story of the Paratime series. Also included is the text of all six of Piper’s Paratime stories.

boardgame.name: Halma
boardgame.description:
Halma version with reduced game board (45 squares) for 2 players. Each player receives 10 pieces. As in normal Halma, you have to move your pieces to the opponent's side first to win.

Note: the board is different to the board used in Mini-Halma.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Perseverance: Part 1
boardgame.description:
Perseverance is an episodic visual novel drama about survival and redemption. Play as Jack and Karen – two characters whose paths cross in the middle of horrific events. Witness a gripping story from both perspectives. Your choices will shape the story’s outcome.

Perseverance: Part 1 is the first installment of a horror & drama story revolving around two different characters whose paths will cross in a middle of horrific events.

In Part 1 you play as Jack Cutter, a father who is struggling to keep his family together. He’s a ‘go-to’ guy in his hometown of Grey Ville. On the surface Grey Ville looks like a peaceful town, but research conducted in a nearby military base gives it a mysterious aura. Residents prefer to stay away from it, however, they love to speculate on what’s going on there. Things take an unexpected turn and the area is quarantined.

Meanwhile, a mysterious woman is after a fugitive. Her superiors expect her to fulfill her orders as usual. But they are not telling her everything. The person she’s after is more than what she appears to be.

Soon both Jack and the mystery agent will find themselves in a middle of a crisis that will change them forever.

Inspirations

We were inspired by stories like “Night of the Living Dead”, “28 Days Later”, “Blindness” and most of all – “The Walking Dead”.

Our goal is to show the drama of individuals in the face of terrifying events.

Key Features:


PLAY at your own pace
IMMERSE yourself in a gripping story
EXPERIENCE the first installment of a bigger plot
CHOOSE and create your own version of Jack
UNLOCK several steam achievements


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Moon
boardgame.description:
[back cover blurb]
Designed for use with Cepheus Engine or other 2D6 based science fiction games.

Moon is not a scenario, it is a collection of adventure locations set on “Moon” which could be any moon orbiting any planet you wish. Take all the adventure locations or just the ones you want, mix and match how you wish.

On Moon, you’ll find Monaco Ltd operating massive mining machines that traverse the landscape scouring the regolith for valuable minerals.

An imperial heavy cruiser crashed on moon some years ago, the navy then bombarded the wreck and left warning beacons.

Beneath the surface of Moon an underground alien civilisation has been found.

Flying in the thin atmosphere of Moon are massive gliders piloted by the vacationing rich.

Tailored Corp has a dome city on Moon, but the people are not happy and dissent is fermenting.

boardgame.name: Precinct 12
boardgame.description:
[back cover blurb]
Precinct 12 is a campaign primer for Cepheus Engine (or other 2D6 based science fiction games) that presents a starport and the surrounding city as a play space for the PCs to adventure across. PCs can play in the space , or use the new “Star cop” career to roll up a cop character charged with patrolling the mean streets of a busy starport city.

The city is rife with crime and competing officials all trying to hustle for money and power. Only the star cops can keep the peace on the streets.

boardgame.name: Speed Tangram
boardgame.description:
Each player receives the same complete set of colorful tangram pieces. 30 playing cards contain laying tasks, the figures, mixed from the correct colors and black parts.
One card is turned face up and the player who first correctly laid the figure receives this card. After that, the next cards are played. The player who has collected the most cards wins.

Note: The game Tangram Race is designed similarly, with the difference that there are no colors given in the pieces to be laid.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Folly of Ponsonby-Wild
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This is the first scenario in the four part A Very British Horror campaign set in 1921 England.

The investigators are invited to a funeral of the husband of an old friend. However he was part of a dark cult whose tendrils reach far into the heart of the British establishment. The investigators must uncover the facts of his death and put a stop to the cult's plan.

boardgame.name: The Wombwell Stones
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This is the second scenario in the four part A Very British Horror campaign set in 1921 England.

Set in York, the investigators are looking for a missing woman but are soon involved in a plot involving alien artefacts and an attempt to strike at the heart of the British Empire and kill the Prime Minister and the King at a Rememberance Service at York Minster.

boardgame.name: Streets: Kickstarter Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
This Kickstarter exclusive promo pack expands the number of Building tiles available for Streets and includes some additional new content and components:


10 new Building tiles
4 “big” silkscreened meeples (Tourist, Hipster, Shopper & Parent) each representing 5 ordinary meeples
2 new Consultants
Tile dividers for the game box
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Streets

boardgame.name: Die Kleine Raupe Nimmersatt: Mein erstes Würfelspiel
boardgame.description:
A panel with butterfly is covered with a frame in which there is a 10-piece puzzle for the cocoon. The figure of the little caterpillar starts on the sun field of the run around the cocoon puzzle. You roll the dice and move to the corresponding fruit; if there is a leaf there or you rolled a leaf, you take one. If the second die shows the cocoon, you may remove a puzzle piece. When all pieces are removed and the butterfly is visible, the player with the most leaves wins.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: World of Eric Carle (University Games)

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieldauer: 10 Minuten Altersempfehlung: ab 3 Jahren
Die kleine Raupe Nimmersatt - Mein erstes Würfelspiel Die kleine Raupe Nimmersatt hat großen Hunger! Würfelt, und lauft mit ihr von Frucht zu Frucht, damit sie sich satt essen und ein großer wunderschöner Schmetterling werden kann. Spielen und lernen mit der kleinen Raupe Nimmersatt: Dieses einfache Würfelspiel fördert die Entwicklung von Regelverständnis und Konzentrationsvermögen.
https://youtu.be/J6-MAmEQu9M
Inhalt: 1 Raupe-Nimmersatt-Spielfigur 1 Spielplan (Papptafel, ein Rahmen und 10 Puzzleteilen) 2 Würfel 28 Blätter
Spielziel: Lauft mit der kleinen Raupe Nimmersatt von Frucht zu Frucht und helft ihr, ein wunder- schöner Schmetterling zu werden. Wer dabei die meisten Blätter sammelt, gewinnt das Spiel.
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, FR, IT

boardgame.name: Time of the Serpent
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Time of the Serpent is an urban adventure set in 1920s Chicago where the investigators are caught up in a grisly double murder at a local speakeasy called The Kiss.

This scenario also includes audio handouts.

boardgame.name: Monopoly Junior: Peppa Pig
boardgame.description:
Play with family Wutz and Peppa Pig. Move around the playground and buy places from Peppa's world! As soon as one player runs out of money, the others count their banknotes. The player with the most money wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Shadow on the Sea
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Shadow on the Sea is a scenario set on the south coast of England in the 1920s. The investigators attend a lecture at the Royal Institution and are asked by a professor (via a note with money attached) to pick a certain something up from a beach in Kent

boardgame.name: Bark Avenue
boardgame.description:
Bark Avenue is a competitive route optimization pick up and deliver game centered around a day in the life of a dog walker in upper Manhattan. Players balance walking several dogs at once with competing needs - including walk length, preferred activities, bathroom breaks, and compatibility with your other dogs.

You will be challenged with solving the puzzle of returning dogs on time and determining which dogs to walk next! In between walks, use public transportation to your advantage to position yourself for the best walks.

As you progress in your dog walking career, your good ratings will unlock new abilities, such as walking more dogs simultaneously, going off leash at the dog park, and taking more end-of-turn actions, including pickups and activities like visiting pet shops. Be wary of returning dogs late, because you could lose out on most the pay!

At 45 minutes - 1 hour, this Gateway+ game is targeted at all players and pulls in dog lovers, providing fun for new gamers and critical thinking and optimization problems for seasoned gamers.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Olympia Spiel
boardgame.description:
The players start at the "Sporthilfe" space. Movement is determined by a die. If a meeple gets on a sports space, he puts the corresponding athlete card on that space.

If a meeple gets on a space with an athlete card he has to compete for a bronze medal by playing condition cards. The winner places his athlete card and the bronze medal on the space. The next competition on this space is for the silver medal and the loser gets the bronze medal. The third competition on a sports space finally is for the gold medal.

If a meeple gets on a space with a medal, the owner gets points awarded.

On a space "Trainings-camp" the player gets to draw a new condition card.

When all gold medals are awarded, the player with the most medals wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Hot Shot Football
boardgame.description:
One rare edition of the famous "Hot Shot" series from Milton Bradley, is Hot Shot Football. It was released in 1995, only in travel edition. The game don't need any batteries to be played. In each turn you stand against the mechanical goalkeeper (he moves right and left) and you have to score as much goals as you can in 30 seconds. The winner is the player who scores the most penalties after a number of rounds, whose exact number is decided by the players before the game starts.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Alveole
Kuskala
Kuskala
boardgame.description:
Hexagonal version of Lines of Action.

Player move their pieces according to the number of total pieces in the "line of action"

Objective is to consolidate all your own pieces in a connected group.

boardgame.name: Potions: Roll & Write
boardgame.description:
There is little left for the next full moon. When it shines high in the sky, the secret conclave of the potion-makers order of warlocks and withes will begin. Then, the oldest and wisest of the master witches and warlocks, will choose from among the aspirants, the new member of the order, to whom all kinds of secrets will be revealed. Only one will be chosen.

As aspirants, you will have 10 moons to make the most potions and demonstrate your skills. But do not be nervous, you have your magical helpers, who will facilitate the task of collecting ingredients. In addition, you know the formula of the multipurpose potion that will be of great help for you.

Potions is a simple roll and write game, easy to explain and play, with some interaction between players, dice draft, push your luck and set collection.

The players, representing the sorcerer's apprentices, will have 10 turns to brew more potions than their rivals and be the winner.
On your turn you roll the 6 dice, which you can reroll up to 2 times. Then you will choose a value and you will take all the dice with that value that you will spend in the best way to complete the ingredients of the potions. Players will be able to activate their helpers by choosing the appropriate die value. Also the more complicated potions will provide bonuses.

Created for the 8th BGG Roll and Write Game Design Contest.

boardgame.name: The Book of Fiends (5e)
boardgame.description:
A Malefic Bestiary for Fifth Edition

From back of book:
Devils, demons, and daemons—these are the ultimate servants of evil. Learn all of
their foul secrets in The Book of the Fiends, the definitive sourcebook on these fell
creatures. This tome presents an assortment of horrific fiends hailing from Hell, the
Abyss, and Gehenna. Drawing inspiration from the classic supplement of this same name,
all the creatures, character options, and more have been reimagined for use with the world’s
most popular roleplaying game. This book builds on the information found in the core
rulebooks, by expanding and revealing all you could ever want to know about these evil
planes. The Book of Fiends is jam-packed with evil for your campaign, including:
• Over 130 daemons, devils, demons, and other creatures of the Lower Planes.
• Monsters with challenge ratings from 0 to 31; there are foes for characters of all
levels.
• Info on the celestial choirs and the fallen angels.
• Inspired illustrations by top artists like Mauro Alocci, Dmitri Bielak, Biagio D’alessandro, Stanioslav Dikolenko, Francesco Di Pastena, David Hueso, Katrina Ladon, Alexander Ngo, Mirco Paganessi, Svetoslav Petrov, Nicholas Phillips,
Daniel Rubio, Levante Ruckert, Phill Simpson, and Andrey Vasilchenko.
• Details on the nine Lords of Hell, the seven Exarchs of Gehenna, and a plethora of
Demon Princes.
• New options to tempt player characters to embrace evil.
• A dozen sinister spells, a new background, new feats, and more!
The Book of Fiends provides profoundly evil foes your players will never forget.

boardgame.name: Spindle
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Spindle is a modern old-school 2D action adventure where you are the new Death, and together with a pig as a companion, you are in search of the reason why nobody in this world can die anymore. Free the world from chaos before it's too late!FEATURES

Solve puzzle based Dungeons
Help people finally die
Put way too much time and effort into mini games
Find hidden bosses
Explore hot deserts, snowy lands and deep swamps
Collect the shattered powers of Death to overcome your obstacles


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Monomyth
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





MONOMYTH is an immersive, first-person dungeon crawling RPG in the vein of Ultima Underworld, Arx Fatalis, and the King’s Field series.Travel through a highly interactive, open game world, unrestricted by scripted sequences, hard-coded barriers or grid-based movement.

Use swords, daggers, hammers, maces, bows or a wide range of versatile spells to overcome your foes in real-time combat!
Remain unseen and unheard by sneaking through the shadows in a light and audio-based stealth system.

Talk with the inhabitants of the underworld through a detailed, keyword-based dialogue system. Trade with them or press them for information. But don’t go too far or you may suffer the consequences!

Experiment with a wide range of utility items: Speed potions, water arrows, lockpicks, and many more! A highly interactive world awaits you! Douse torches, bake bread, drink from fountains, and even play instruments!

Unravel the mysteries of Lysandria as you uncover hidden passages, dive through flooded caves, and overcome the living nightmares that inhabit the ancient halls far below the mighty fortress.

Features


Open (under)world exploration
Dungeon crawling without grid-movement
Detailed character system with 8 unique attributes
Eleven diverse skills (from Athletics to Lockpicking)
Emergent gameplay through spells and utility items
Five vast underworld zones filled with secrets and treasure
Deadly foes and hidden traps
Light and sound-based stealth system
Interactive Environments: Can’t open a door? Break it down or blow it up!
Over 30 spells and just as many weapons
Keyword-based NPC conversations coupled with dialogue trees
Designed around freedom: Fight everyone and still finish the game
Immersive Microfeatures: Bake bread, Get drunk, play instruments, etc


Source: The Game Press Kit.

Dune: Betrayal
Dune: Verrat
boardgame.description:
In the social deduction game Dune: Betrayal, players take on the identity of one of the iconic characters of Dune, each representing a distinct role within the factions vying for control amid the sands of Dune.

Your goal is to learn the identities of your foes while protecting your nobles, forming alliances, and utilizing tools to gain knowledge, and therefore power. Pay close attention to determine your allies and enemies, then defend your allies and attack your foes to secure victory.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: TrollFest
boardgame.description:
For the first time, your band which so far had mostly played in shady goblin and vampire venues has been invited to take part in the great TrollFest, where you will be the opening act for such big names like the Rolling Gnomes and Snow White and the Dwarves.

In TrollFest, each player manages a rock band in a fantasy universe, recruits the most talented and charismatic musicians, holds concerts in the main city, hires dragons for transport and light shows, and ends up trying to give the best act at the festival.

After an initial card draft of band members and action cards, players take turns moving around the map, performing shows and improving their band composition to score points. Once one player has completed their tour (by performing in a certain number of cities), the game ends and players score additional points based on their final band configuration.

TrollFest is a light, fun and thematic 3 to 6 player boardgame for friends and family.
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for TrollFest

boardgame.name: World-Z League
boardgame.description:
Zombies are taking over your town... it's time to start shooting! (with rubber bands, that is).

Players set up zombie meeples in their player colors in and around chipboard buildings, then take turns trying to shoot down opposing zombies with rubber bands. Score points for opposing ones, but be careful not to knock over your own in the process!

boardgame.name: Underground, Lost & Found: An Escape Room Style Game
boardgame.description:
The Domestic Counter Terrorism Office (DCTO) is at a dead end. Five devices have been hidden around the London underground. One was found at Westminster Station and it was disguised as a cactus!

The DCTO needs your help in working out where the other devices are, what they are disguised as, and what their 6-digit disarm codes are.

This is a difficult escape room style deduction game that should keep you occupied for an evening. You might want to enlist some help. Perfect for a group, or try it solo for the expert detectives out there.

HQ will send you all the intel and leads they have on the case. It's up to you to sort through all of the evidence and solve the puzzle by entering the answers online.

boardgame.name: Five Faces of Fear
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

FIVE FACES OF FEAR is a collection of five ready to play scenarios for Call of Cthulhu 7th Edition. Within these pages you will find a setting guide to Modern Ireland, as well as adventure, mystery and horror that will take you from modern day Cape Town to Victorian Liverpool, rural Ireland and even to the Peninsular War.

Silent Key - A radio message from a dead friend raises questions about his strange behaviour.

Where Nothing Ever Happens - The search for a missing writer’s lost work reveals the truth behind his disappearance.

Midterm Getaway - Trapped between unnatural forces, a fun boat trip quickly turns into a fight for survival.

Brothers in Arms - A stolen artifact leads to the discovery of an ancient horror.

War to the Knife - A group of spies find more than they bargained for whilst tracking down their missing Comrade.

These scenarios have been written and illustrated by active members of the Irish gaming community, who between them hold multiple accolades including three National Game Writer of the Year awards, two Contribution to Irish Gaming Awards and multiple winners for Best Scenario at various gaming conventions.

boardgame.name: Chromaville Cold Case: A Murder Mystery
boardgame.description:
Dear Detective, You're obviously aware of the unsolved murder of David Cuthbertson.

As his prodigy and one of the top detectives in the country, I do hope you will be able to crack it. His body was discovered by a dog walker in Chromaville at 6am on Saturday 14th March 2020. I can send you all the information I have gathered surrounding the case.

David appears to have been conducting cases of his own and was found with an interesting array of paperwork on his person. I will also include this to help you with your investigation. Any help you can give me in solving this case would be greatly appreciated.

Try your hand at this tricky murder mystery ‘whodunnit’ and solve the case of David Cuthbertson. Expect 2-3 hours of mind boggling twists and turns as you unveil the truth behind this awful crime... great for a couple of budding detectives, or as a gift for the inspector in your life.

boardgame.name: Don't Look Back: The Curse of Oak Hill Expansion
boardgame.description:
In the early 1800's miners in the North Hills blasted into a large open cavity deep underground. Inside, strange images were scrawled on the walls and hundreds of items littered the floor. The miners stared at the objects, some strange and some recognizable. Most were made from carved stone, wood, and even gold. Not sure what they had found, the miners quickly divided up the items. Over the next several months the miners began to hear strange voices and some went missing. They would claim the items they had found would wander from room to room, showing up in unexpected spots. It wasn't until children around the camp began to vanish that the miners decided to act. Declaring the items cursed they returned them to the chamber where they had been found and blasted the entrance closed.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 1 Father Gabriel Hero miniature, 1 Demon Killer miniature, and 1 custom scenario to the base game.

boardgame.name: Invasores
boardgame.description:
La Conspiracion Alienigena

From the introduction:

Invasores is a complete role-playing game that uses a simple and flexible system, and includes three adventures to get you right into fighting against the agents of the conspiracy. All you need to play is a few six-sided dice, and a bit of imagination.

boardgame.name: Emperor!
boardgame.description:
Emperor! is a eurogame-style game that takes place in 11th century Constantinople, and is centred around the battle for the imperial throne.

Emperor! has a unique two-phase feature. In phase one players move around a map of the city collecting money, military units and characters to build up their faction. Game play is card-based, with simultaneous turns, so bluff and negotiation are important.

Then, in phase two, the board flips over to a simple, diagrammatic battlefield. The players cash in their cards and sets to buy more military units. These are deployed face-down on the battle map. Players then select tactical cards (outflank, charge! etc) for their army and combat is resolved.

Emperor! is card-based with no dice. It takes 30-90 minutes to play.

boardgame.name: Maken-Ki!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Well, you are going to a very nice-looking world there, jumper! You’re about to go to the Japan of the 2010s, though one that’s filled to the brim with ridiculously beautiful and often buxom girls and women, along with many lewd situations for those to end up in! But if you think this world is just made of perverted hijinx and carefree school life, then you’d be dead wrong.

boardgame.name: Actual Cannibal Shia LaBeouf Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You've just completed one jump and are preparing for your next when all of a sudden you're walking in the woods, there's no one around and your phone is dead. Out of the corner of your eye you spot him. He's following you about 30 feet back. He gets down on all fours and breaks into a sprint. He's gaining on you. You're looking for your warehouse key, but you're all turned around. He's almost upon you now and you can see there's blood on his face! My god, there's blood everywhere!

boardgame.name: Magic Sword Tactics
魔剣Tactics
boardgame.description:
Magic Sword Tactics is a tower defense game for solo play.

Use the power of the magic sword to fight against the Demon King's army that is attacking the city.
The game is cleared when you defeat the Demon King before he destroys the city.

Roll the 10-sided die to inflict the damage set for each demon sword.

Build a better deck of swords to fight the Demon King's army!

boardgame.name: 狸と茶釜 (Tanuki to Chagam)
boardgame.description:
狸と茶釜 (Tanuki to Chagam) is a card game from Japan. Each player predicts how many times he will win from the dealt hand and declares all at once. After that, each player takes out one card from his hand, compares the strength of that card, and the player who puts out the strongest card receives all the cards in the field. Basically, you have to play a card of the same color as the first player to play, and if you don't have that color in your hand, you can play any card you like.

In addition, there is a tea pot card among the cards, and if you meet the following three conditions, you can change the card you issued to 0, which is the same color as the tea pot card.

1) The tea pot card is already in play.
2) The number of the raccoon dog card you put out is larger than the number of the tea pot card.
3)The tea pot card is not already used for another raccoon card.

Make good use of the timing when the Chagama card is issued and adjust the number of times you win. When everyone runs out of hands, they move on to score calculation, and the score is determined by the difference between the number of wins they declared and the actual result.

The player who plays the game for the number of players and has the highest total score is the winner of the game.

-translated from Jellyjelly Cafe website

日本の昔話「ぶんぶく茶釜」をモチーフにしたマストフォローのビッド式トリックテイキングです。
4スート1-9の36枚で構成され、2、5、8が茶釜カード、その他は狸カードです。
茶釜には1匹の狸が隠れられ隠れた狸はトリックに必ず負けることが出来ます。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Atlanta Besieged: Regimental Wargame Scenarios For The Atlanta Campaign – July 1864
boardgame.description:
The battles around Atlanta during the American Civil War were pivotal to the outcome of the conflict.
Confederate General John B. Hood threw his army against the forces of General William T. Sherman in an effort to save the city from capture.
The battles were hard fought and bloody, but ultimately ended in the capture of Atlanta.
Can you be a better general on the game table?

These scenarios are designed to be used with almost any American Civil War regimental or brigade level set of rules.
Rules are included for figures based on 20, 30, 40, 50, and 100 historic men per figure/stand.
Times are given for 10, 15, and 20 minutes per game turn.
Maps are in full color, as are the numerous color photographs of the modern battlefield.

This book does not contain rules for playing miniature wargames.

Scenarios include:

Ruff’s Mill
The Battle of Peachtree Creek: Eastern Flank
Bald Hill
The Battle of Atlanta: Sixteenth Corps
The Battle of Atlanta: Seventeenth Corps
The Battle of Atlanta: Hardee’s Attack
The Battle of Atlanta: Fifteenth Corps
Ezra Church
Sunshine Church


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Art Smart
boardgame.description:
Art Smart is an art auction game for 3-5 players in which all players buy and sell art – but watch out for fake pieces.

Depending on the number of players each player gets dealt a number of Painting cards and an equal number of Fake/Real cards.

Every round of the game is an auction where a Painting card gets auctioned off in which the auctioneer participates as well. After the painting is sold and the money is handed over, it's established if the painting was Real or Fake and the Artist's value goes up or down.

After all Paintings are auctioned the game ends and the player who owns the combined highest value of Paintings wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Wonky Blocks
boardgame.description:
The aim of the game is to rid your hand of all cards, or to stack all 9 blocks - which is highly unlikely. Play a card from your initial hand of seven, and place a block on the stack, using only one hand. The cards specify size and/or colour of the block to be played. The stack may not be steadied. If the stack collapses, take 3 cards as penalty, and start a new stack. The two action cards are pass and reverse direction.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Star Swapper
boardgame.description:
Star Swapper is space puzzle game with relaxing gameplay. Complete each level by moving and arranging symbols, so they form existing star constellations. As you progress the game introduces new space mechanics such as Wormholes or Red Giants. The game is conveniently divided into chapters and levels. Each level has a score system which depends on number of moves you make and the amount of time you finish a level in. The game encourages short game sessions. Focus and plan your moves.

Features

SOLVE puzzles, and enjoy your journey towards the final frontier
JUMP RIGHT IN thanks to intuitive game controls
ENJOY relaxing gameplay and enchanting soundtrack
IMMERSE yourself in space ‪aesthetics‬
CHALLENGE your mind with 98 various puzzles
UNLOCK 27 steam achievements


Source: The Game Press Kit.

Shadows of Brimstone: Temple of Shadows Deluxe Expansion

boardgame.name: Olympic Judo
boardgame.description:
Statistical game to replay all JUDO Olympic Tournaments of History.
Very quick play.
Single fight resolved by two rolls of 3 six dice.
Very realistic results but some surprises may occur like in real sport.

boardgame.name: Sprengstoff Vorsicht!
boardgame.description:
From the powder room of the author of Zündstoff. 312 brand new questions about everyday life, career, sex, friends, family, psychoanalysis and philosophy. Each player will ask one of the 6 questions to the other players and a voting system allow to give points for each answer.

—user summay

boardgame.name: Felix Mau-Mau
boardgame.description:
Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color, number, or word to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Religious Freaks
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A bunch freaky monstruous cultist for the Babalonian Jam!

They include a little bit of lore and are very different from one another, enjoy!

boardgame.name: The Garkain
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Garkain is a territorial, flesh-hungering creature of Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander legend.

It ambushes its prey from above, enveloping them in it's fleshy wings and suffocating them with a stench so foul, it tears their very soul away.

boardgame.name: Nechrubel's Chimera
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A monster from the Valley of the Unfortunate Undead.

boardgame.name: Executioner of Nechrubel
boardgame.description:
From the description:

"Nechrubel hath commanded it. So shall it be. You are sentenced to die. Do not resist."

A highly powerful servant of the Dark Lord for the Babalonian Jam.

boardgame.name: Tom Piper Good Citizen Shopping Game
boardgame.description:
Tom Piper Good Citizen Shopping Game is a simple roll and move board game promoting products from a company called Tom Piper Ltd.

The Australian company Tom Piper Ltd. manufactured canned meals, fruit juice, soup, cordial, jam, baked beans, spaghetti, tomato sauce and desserts from late 1948 till 1972.

This promotional game can be played with one or two dice and players follow a path of 90 squares leaving home, passing through a supermarket isle advertising Tom Piper products and then continuing until home is once again reached.

Along the way players can advance or be sent backwards based on good deeds or thoughtless acts. Landing on a square with the Tom Piper Logo also has a bonus move. First to reach home by exact count is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Die wilden Hühner auf Klassenfahrt
boardgame.description:
Where the wild chicken gang appears, it goes around: All players put a playing card on their head and off they go! The players try to place matching wild chickens cards in pairs. But watch out, if the card falls off the head, it's "chicken overboard". The winner is always the one who is the fastest. When you discard cards, you win all the cards that are on the pile with the cards that have already been revealed. When shouting "chicken overboard", you only win the card that has fallen down or that is not right.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Critical Mass: Power Transceiver promo card
boardgame.description:
Promotional card for 'Critical Mass' available via the Dice Tower and the BGG Store.

Text on the card reads "All your (electrical) weapons gain +1 firepower".
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Critical Mass: Patriot vs Iron Curtain
Critical Mass: Raijin vs Archon

boardgame.name: Playmobil: Caos alla fattoria
Playmobil: Remue-ménage à la ferme
Playmobil: Wirbel auf dem Bauernhof
boardgame.description:
In this fun laying game, speed and close looking are required, because not all parts are the same size. The first to put all the matching parts in his frame wins the PLAYMOBIL figure.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Critical Mass: Reinforce promo card
boardgame.description:
Promotional card for 'Critical Mass' originally available the BGG store.

The card text is "Put back into play any of your destroyed armor plates whose combined durability is 3 or less".
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Critical Mass: Patriot vs Iron Curtain
Critical Mass: Raijin vs Archon

boardgame.name: Pictofun
boardgame.description:
Pictures must be placed in a chain as long as possible. To do this, the other players must accept an association with a free category and the current card. You draw and show a card and name an association; in teams, the association named first is valid. If the association is not accepted or if there is no free space, the card is discarded and a new one is drawn. Another team/player can take this card and use it for a free category, it scores 2 points after time expires; the active team scores 1 point per card in the longest chain. The first to reach 25 points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: BrainBox: Das große Quiz
boardgame.description:
You answer questions in the colors of the location fields of your figure, the side walls of the game box fold out to form the game board. You roll the dice and move in any direction, not diagonally and not twice across a field; if you answer the question of the category you have reached correctly, you get the card. You look at the card, memorize as many details as possible and then answer the question, it is read aloud by the other player and determined by the roll of the dice. The player who has a card of each category wins. Special fields change the rules of the game for the active player.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Mirroring of Mary King
boardgame.description:
The Mirroring of Mary King is a two-player game in which one person is a mortal contemporary woman named Mary King and the other player is the ghost of Mary’s long dead ancestor, a 17th century Scottish merchant burgess of the same name. While on a week’s holiday in Edinburgh, Mary visits Mary King’s Close where her presence attracts the spirit of her long dead ancestor, now a hungry ghost that wants to live again in Mary’s body. The two Marys engage in a battle for control of the living Mary’s mortal body.

Players use control cards and power cards to exert their influence on Mary King’s psyche, represented by 12 tiles arranged in a 4 x 3 grid. These tiles are flipped back and forth throughout the game as the players gain and lose control of them.

The game progresses over five days, starting on Monday and ending on Friday. Each player gets one turn each day, with the ghost player always going first. As the week progresses, the mortal and the ghost become more exhausted and more desperate: the number of control cards each may play decreases and the number of ideas they may pursue increases. At the end of each player’s turn, both players suffer penalties based on the tiles of Mary that their opponent controls.

A player may immediately win the game by completing their image of Mary using the 12 tiles, or if their opponent runs out of cards. If neither player completes their image of Mary by the end of Friday, the winner is determined by a scoring system based on their remaining cards and their control of Mary.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 5 Piliers: Edition Junior
5 Pillars: Junior Edition
boardgame.description:
Learn all about the basics of Islam while having loads of fun with your family and friends!

Discover, play and learn, with a journey through the pillars of Islam, pillars of Iman, Quran, Sunnah and Muslim Manners. Can you beat your friends, classmates or parents at all five difficulty levels?
References from the Quran and Hadith are given so you learn more about Islam with every flip of the card.

Play for minutes or hours, but for the best learning experience don’t stop until you have mastered and learnt the basics of Islam.

How do I play?
You'll get into two teams, select your level of difficulty for each topic, and answer questions to fill up the pillars.
Conquer all pillars across five difficulty levels before the other team to win!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kleine Fische ganz groß!
boardgame.description:
Boardgame following basic rules and theme of the Card Game Kleine Fische.

25 randomly drawn cards, which are either fish cards or cave cards, are laid out face down on a game board. The aim of the game is for the players to score the most points by collecting fish and treasure.
The players diving through the sea, starting from the boat adjacent to the playing field, which can be moved as first step. The diver (players figure)can always move to neighbouring fields, but must keep to the swimming direction. As soon as the diver reaches a fish card, he uncovers it and decides whether to stop or continue swimming.
If he continues to swim, the next fish card must be turned over. You have to stop your turn as soon as a fish type is revealed twice. You then lose both of this type.
There are also caves to be explored. You need to uncovered as many fish as the number on the cave card indicates, before exploring it. If this is successful, the diver receives the advantage of the cave card.
As soon as you end (freely or forced to), the 2nd phase is carried out. In this phase, the octopus is moved depending on the number of octopus symbols on the revealed fish cards. As soon as the octopus lands on a field with a diver, it tries to steal a fish from the diver. This is done like in the origiginal card game by a setting a number of cards and rolling a dice from the active player. In case of success (equal or higher the number) the octopus robes this number of cards for the active player. With a -1 he loses 1 card, which he has to give to the robbed player.

The active player now gets all cards which are open.
The places are refilled from a stack. The game ends when this is not possible for all empty fields.
From the fish cards only the highest card from each fish type counts. The points from the treasure cards and from the fish cards are added.
The player with the highest points wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Deckula!
boardgame.description:
After a century of slumber, you awaken to discover your castle in a disgraceful state. This will not do! Vampires are, after all, connoisseurs of the very best that (un)life has to offer... Renovate the most imposing rooms of your lair! Fill the halls with ghoulish servants! Drink a fine wine, pose dramatically on the highest tower, and write dreadful poetry! But beware the curious and bold locals that might wander by - perhaps you can invite them in...for a drink?

Deckula is a darkly-comic card game of high stakes (sorry) where you try to balance a decadent lifestyle with fending off aspiring vampire hunters and looters. It's quick and easy-to-play, with scalable difficulty and a small footprint.

The objective of the game is to make it to the end of the deck without getting killed by any visitors to the castle. Each turn, you have a simple decision to make - draw a card and decide whether to buy it (adding it to your tableau) or discard it (gaining energy points to purchase future cards). Many cards are worth victory points and most of them feature a variety of tricky effects you can use to defend yourself and manipulate the flow of play. The visitor cards are the exception - they'll instantly enter a 'threat area' and have a couple of nasty effects that can affect your score or even destroy you, if you're not careful. The challenge is playing as many high-scoring cards as possible while still keeping the negative effects of the visitors under control.

The game ends when you make it to the end of the deck - winning the game and scoring your cards - or when a visitor or other card effect causes you to lose.

—description from the designer

In the 2021 Solitaire Print & Play Contest, Deckula won:
-1st place in Best Use of Theme
-2nd place in Best Graphic Design
-2nd place in Best New Solo Designer

boardgame.name: Wo hat der Rauhaardackel sein h gelassen?
boardgame.description:
In Germany there are many words where even Germans are not sure how to spell them. Especially characters like h, which are not spoken or double/triple characters in sequence make here problems.
This game has 50 of this classic German language traps, as quiz cards with the description of the rules and their origin for clarification.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Marvel United: Classic Cardboard Villain Dashboards
boardgame.description:
A full set of all Villain Dashboards included in the original Marvel United campaign, printed on thick cardboard tiles. This includes all Villain Dashboards found in the original Marvel United core box and all of the expansions and Stretch Goals added to the original campaign, for a total of 29 dashboards, including the oversized Sinister Six Dashboard.

3 Villain Dashboards – Marvel United core box
4 Villain Dashboards – The Infinity Gauntlet
7 Villain Dashboards – Return of the Sinister Six (the Sinister Six one being oversized and including 6 Support Tokens for the Weak Spot cards)
1 Villain Dashboard – Rise of the Black Panther
1 Villain Dashboard – Tales of Asgard
1 Villain Dashboard – Enter the Spider-Verse
1 Villain Dashboard – Guardians of the Galaxy Remix
11 Villain Dashboards – Stretch Goals
3 Mission Tiles (Plan B)


The Villain Dashboards are updated to display on their backs the extra Action tokens Heroes get when facing that Villain in the new Super Villain mode! (That information will also be freely available for download.)

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Marvel United Core Box Classic Cardboard Villain Dashboards (Red Skull, Taskmaster, Ultron)

boardgame.name: Noot vir Noot
boardgame.description:
Noot vir Noot is a board game based on a T.V. musical quiz game show in South Africa with the same name. It is the longest continually running television game show in the country with it's first broadcast in 1991 to present.

The aim of the game is to progress from the first block to the last "5 in a row" block. The player who arrives there first and correctly completes the task is the winner and receives the complete contents of the "kitty" as a prize.

boardgame.name: Topside Miniature Naval Warfare
boardgame.description:
These are the Topside Miniature Naval Warfare Rules accompany our naval miniature sets, and are offered as a basic framework for using and enjoying the miniatures. We tried for the emphasis on playability while giving the player a healthy does of realism. If you are reading this sentence right now, you are probably reading it on paper or in electronic form, rather than written on stone. So read these rules, take the miniatures for a spin, and adjust the battle table to your liking. Season to taste, as the cookbooks say. And enjoy!

Our system allows for a complete interplay between air, naval and submarine combat without bogging down and killing the fun factor. The movement and combat rules are simple but they do add a level of complexity that will require some critical decision making throughout the game. Our goal was to have you focus on the critical decision tree the rules will present you with - and not fight the rules!

A scenario book covering 17 WWII naval battles is available for pdf download.

boardgame.name: Flinkdink
boardgame.description:
Flink Dink features an electronic buzzer component. An electronic umpire is integrated with a colorful playing board. The game provides for three to seven persons the chance to enjoy the excitement of the South African TV show at home.

The objective of the game is to amass the greatest value of prizes by correctly answering the various general knowledge questions provided.

boardgame.name: Fringo
boardgame.description:
Fringo is a guess the word party game, with the usual approach of one team member trying to describe the word to others, but there is one catch: the description needs to be in the form of questions.

If the word was 'Germany', the description could be "What is a big country in the Central Europe? Which country's capital is Berlin?" and so on.

The words are categorized into five classes: around the world, animals and nature, famous people, sports, and history. At the start of the game each team gets a board with squares with category names, which are then filled with tokens of corresponding categories.

Teams then take turns with rotating member as the one who tries to get the team to guess the words of needed categories. They can explain as many words as they manage as long as there is time sand timer. Afterwards the team can flip as many category tokens as they guessed words correctly. First team to flip all of them wins the game.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: WOW! What a World of Entertainment AB

boardgame.name: Darkness Rising
boardgame.description:
You play a ranger who is trying to save villagers by navigating through a wilderness that is rapidly being taken over by a dark force. Luck and strategy are required to survive the journey and fight the monsters.

You must navigate by rolling a dice and filling in the hex grid with the corresponding pathways. Every round one hex is eliminated making it harder to navigate. When the pathways go out of bounds you must fight monsters by rolling dice and matching each monsters pattern. Your goal is to collect as many villagers as you can and navigate to safety. Sometimes you must make the hard decision to sacrifice your villagers to the monsters and elements so that you can survive.

—description from the designer
